com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.engine

Class SpenControlList

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.engine.SpenControlBase
        • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.engine.SpenControlList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback

    public class SpenControlList
extends SpenControlBase
    The control class that manages list object. ControlList is a sub class of ControlBase. It is a control class that manages more than two objects which are selected. The control will accordingly by the attributes in each object in the list. (i.e., border style, rotation, resizing, etc.)

    The ControlList could be setting as a group, which control in a one group instead of separated object control. By using setGroup(boolean) to define as a group or not. The Group object follow the minimum rule, once any one object in the Group without resize-able, rotate-able, move-able attributes, then the group object will not has the relative attributes.

    Remarks
    SpenControlList manages a bunch of object that is selected by area selecting action, and SpenControlContainer manages just one SpenObjectContainer object.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    See Also:
    SpenControlContainer

      • setGroup

        @Deprecated
public void setGroup(boolean groupFlag)
        Deprecated. 
        Tie up all object in control list. The groupFlag will decide the all objects, which been selected, become a group (groupFlag in true). Or divided each object individually (groupFlag in false). If the setting is group, the any object in this group with STYLE_BORDER_NONE, then the group attribute is STYLE_BORDER_NONE. Also any object in this group is non-rotate-able, then the group attribute is non-rotate-able.
        Parameters:
        groupFlag - Set to true to tie up all objects in a group, set to false to untie up all objects operating as an individual object.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        isGroup(), onDraw(Canvas canvas)

      • isGroup

        @Deprecated
public boolean isGroup()
        Deprecated. 

        Check if the objects in the list are grouped.
        Returns:
        true if the objects in the list is in a group, false otherwise.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
